byline.contributor: Natalie Pita reported from Columbia, and Alan Blinder from Atlanta. Richard Pérez-Peña contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By NATALIE PITA and ALAN BLINDER

abstract: Joseph C Meek Jr, friend of Charleston, SC, gunman Dylan S Roof, enters not guilty plea to charges of concealing Roof's plans to carry out massacre at Emanuel AME Church; Meek faces up to five years in prison and $250,000 fine on charge of lying to the federal authorities, and up to three years in prison and a $250,000 fine on a charge of concealing knowledge of felony.
lead_paragraph: A federal grand jury accused Joseph C. Meek Jr. of withholding information in the investigation of Mr. Roof, who has been charged with killing nine inside a church.

headline.main: Friend of Dylann Roof Pleads Not Guilty to Charges in Charleston Shooting
headline.print_headline: Defendant’s Friend Pleads Not Guilty to Charges in Charleston Shooting

snippet: A federal grand jury accused Joseph C. Meek Jr. of withholding information in the investigation of Mr. Roof, who has been charged with killing nine inside a church.

keywords.value: Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church (Charleston, SC)
